definitions.text: the upper side of the thighs of a seated person
examples: he picked up the little girl and plopped her down in his lap

definitions.text: an area of control or responsibility
examples: the job fell right in my lap

definitions.text: the part of a piece of clothing that covers the thighs
examples: his lap was covered with food stains

definitions.text: a flap that lies over another part
examples: the lap of the shingles should be at least ten inches
he drove an extra lap just for insurance
the dog's laps were warm and wet

definitions.text: lie partly over or alongside of something or of one another
move with or cause to move with a whistling or hissing sound
examples: The bubbles swoshed around in the glass
The cat lapped up the milk
the cub licked the milk from its mother's breast
